originalText: RahmUmbra
Start Element
rahmUmbra
dc-entry
::Rahm-Umbra remains silent.::

::The large figure turns to you, motionless and silent, his several lenses focused on your advent. You face him, expecting a vicious attack, but instead he gives you a moment to realize that his intentions lie elsewhere.::

I will overlook your previous errors, but know that it will be the last time for me to do so. I wish only to speak to you.

::A rumbling voice speaks to you once more.::

You made it. Good.

::A rumbling voice speaks to you once more.::

You made it, oculite. Good.

::There's much that strikes you as wrong upon seeing this person. He is quite tall and a bit too lean for a human. His mechanical prosthetic right arm and left leg are clearly visible. On both his mechanical and healthy hand he has six long thin creepy fingers.::

::Six stands alone amid the ruins. Meeting him here is nothing like your first encounter. Unlike earlier, when he was uninterested and even annoyed with your queries, he now seems intrigued by your presence.::

::There's much that strikes you as wrong as you approach this person. He is quite tall and a bit too lean for a human. His mechanical prosthetic right arm and left leg are clearly visible. On both his mechanical and healthy hand he has six long thin creepy fingers.::
::He doesn't seem interested in talking to you.::

::There's much that strikes you as wrong as you approach this person. He is quite tall and a bit too lean for a human. His mechanical prosthetic right arm and left leg are clearly visible. On both his mechanical and healthy hand he has six long thin creepy fingers.::
context.npc_RahmUmbra_leaveBeginningDeepCaverns
We didn't end our previous encounter on most friendly terms. I thought you'd attack me.

::His face is completely covered and he appears to wear some sort of a metal mask with four protruding lenses, and there's another extension on his very forehead that looks like a short gun barrel. Instead of hair, rigid wires protrude from the back of his head.::
context.npc_rahm-umbra_met

::As the multiple lenses of his helmet focus intently on you, you can feel an oppressive aura weigh down on your mind. As if the walls and the ceiling are closing in on you, you suddenly feel claustrophobic in this large room. You feel tired, merely speaking takes effort.::

::His face is completely covered and he appears to wear some sort of a metal mask with four protruding lenses, and there's another extension on his very forehead that looks like a short gun barrel. Instead of hair, rigid wires protrude from the back of his head.::
Hey, can we speak for a moment?
You're being very rude.
Hey, I'm talking to you.
Damn cybernetic creep...
::Leave him be.::

::His face is completely covered and he appears to wear some sort of a metal mask with four protruding lenses, and there's another extension on his very forehead that looks like a short gun barrel. Instead of hair, rigid wires protrude from the back of his head.::
You need to be alive. It is as simple as that.
Good.
Foolishness, if you will. And the only reason you are not being punished for it is because you need to be alive.
We must speak. I have been waiting for you.

::As he speaks, his deep rumbling voice feels somehow displaced, as if not coming out from his mouth.::

You are here. Good.
This is not the first time I find you oddly in my path, Oculite. What is your business here?
This is not the first time I find you oddly in my path, and yet you do not seem like you belong there. What is your business here, scavenger?
No.
And you are being quite annoying. I have probably shown you more lenience than you warrant. Now go about your business before my patience runs out.
::You only have a fragment of a second to regret your insolence before he descends upon you.::

::As you approach to converse with him, he waves you away. As he speaks, his deep rumbling voice feels somehow displaced, as if not coming out from his mouth.:: 

My business is with Azif.
::Fight!::
::Leave him be.::
Rahm-Umbra.
Do not be intimidated by my appearance. I wish to speak to you.
That's odd. I don't remember seeing you before.
I'm merely passing by.
I could say the same thing about you.
::[Will/Thought Control] Try to fight back against his aura.::
You don't scare me, you cybernetic freak! I ain't answering your questions.
My business is my own.
I have no desire to exchange pleasantries with you. Be on your way.
That is none of your concern. Move along and leave me to my thoughts.
::He doesn't seem pleased with what you said.:: I will give you the benefit of the doubt and assume you did not mean to insult me, but this is the one and only time this will occur.
No.
Lower your tone before it gets you killed, and move along.
Why?
And why is this artifact of interest to you?
I am aware of that. The question still remains, however - what are you here for?
I have no time for games, little $(#man/woman). If you are not useful then you are disposable. Now speak - why have you come here?

::You try to muster the willpower to shrug off the oppressive aura and for a moment it feels like you're succeeding. But soon the grip tightens, pressing your skull inward. Your thoughts are slow and heavy.::
::You try to muster the willpower to shrug off the oppressive aura, but it proves too strong.::
::No threat or battle cry is issued; silently and swiftly he springs to action.::
Now move along before your manners get you killed.
It seems to be the cause of the Faceless invasion, so I want to get to the bottom of this.
Two merchants from my station got killed because they bought it and I want to know why.
::Struggle on...::
Resistance can turn into pain, little $(#man/woman). You will answer my question.
We find ourselves in the same events again and again, oculite. At the Oculus, at the Tchortist institute, and here. These are not coincidences.
We find ourselves in the same events, oculite. At Oculus, and here. And we just barely missed each other at the Institute. These are not coincidences.
We find ourselves in the same events. At the Institute, and here. These are not coincidences.
We haven't met before, yet it is certain that we merely did not perceive each other at the Tchortist institute, rather than not being the participants of the same event.

::He watches you for a while. You feel as if the air pressure is growing in the room. The walls are pressing against your temples, mercury pouring behind your eyes, weighing your thoughts down.::

There is something you are not telling me.
::He looks away from you for the first time since the encounter began. The aura that weighted heavily on you seems to be lifting. He remains silent for a few moments.::

::He watches you for a few moments. It seems that this information caught him off guard. As he asks his next question you feel as if there's something worm-like moving inside your skull.:: And what station are you from?
::You fight back with all your mental strength and manage to break free from his grasp. Surprised and angered by this, he attacks.::
A valiant effort, but you *will* answer my questions. What is your business here?
As I connect events I have witnessed, I wonder in how many more of those we passed by each other, unaware that the other one was nearby.
No, there isn't.

This is true, but it is a dangerous place you are heading to if you keep following their prize. If you are concerned for the welfare of your kin, the best course of action would be to stay out of their way.
South Gate Station.
::[Intelligence]:: So you too want the Cube?
You too want that cube, right? I remember we spoke about it at the Institute.
I will give you one more chance to tell the truth. ::You feel pain in the left side of your skull.::
::He looks away from you for the first time since the encounter began. The aura that weighted heavily on you seems to be lifting. He remains silent.::
::He studies you a while.:: I could see that lie as it pulsed through your brain, neuron to neuron. It matters not - your dead body will tell me everything I need to know.
It matters not - your dead body will tell me everything I need to know.
Yes, but for a different reason than you.
The artifact led both of us here. We have been seeking it for a different reason, though, but our events are connected.
Watch your tone, little $(#man/woman). If you do wish to leave this place alive, you will listen to what I have to say. I am here for the very same object you are looking for.
It is of no use to you. Let it find its way to its owners.
::He says nothing.::

The artifact - it is in possession of what you know as Tchort. Tchort must be destroyed, and the artifact returned to the Tunnelers, Faceless, refer to them as you wish. They are not your enemies; you share more common goals than you had ever thought.
We both should be leaving this place now. Danger draws near.
::End Dialog.::
There is no time.
Your questions are sidetracking the conversation. Listen, and I will tell you what you need to know.
tch_rahmLeaves
It appears so. You will play an important part in Tchort's destruction, or even outright destroy it on your own.
Your arrival here is not a coincidence. You will play an important part in Tchort's destruction, or even outright destroy it on your own.
You should leave this place - the Institute. If you stay, you will surely die. Danger draws near.

All events which have led to this one here have produced a setting, a frame - your deficient language prevents me from conveying the meaning properly - in which the only outcome is for you and Tchort to meet. The only possible way for you to create an exit out of Deep Caverns is to destroy Tchort. I have contemplated it greatly, considered possibilities you are not remotely aware of, and I inferred no alternative.

That is not my event. I find it difficult to explain, as I have stated, but it is something that must occur, and you are the main participant. Of course, I could be wrong about you and this frame ends up being your grave, this conversation meaningless to you and detrimental to me.

The information you gave me at the Tchortist Institute, the name of the station you are from - that revealed another connection for me to consider. Connection to the artifact, to your events and... to my events. Connection that revealed the one who orchestrated your moves for his benefit alone. The more I ponder these things, the more I am confident that what I am telling you is correct.
The more I ponder the events which led you here, however, the more I am confident that what I am telling you is correct.
To make certain these things occur. My presence here was not related to Tchort originally. But as I learned of it, of its name, it became more important. Most important.

It is an entity, an embodiment of something that must not be allowed to prevail. I cannot tell you what that is, for I do not know yet myself. Perhaps I will have these answers ready for some other event.

::His arm extends, pointing toward the tunnel.:: This way leads to Tchort's domain. After you step into it, you will be prone to its influence; your fragile mind will be exposed to violation. Far to the north, you will see an entangled gate; behind it lies Tchort.
The details of Tchort's destruction I do not know. After it is done, again, the artifact must be returned to the Faceless.
I will share such information.
I am not interested in what you think of me. No, I only care about the outcome of these events.
There is no other option. Whether you end up victorious or a stain in the ground, the only way for you to leave this place is by being a participant in Tchort's destruction.
The only way for you to leave this place is by being a participant in Tchort's destruction. There is no other option, little $(#man/woman), and you will quickly realize that.
I can offer you all I know about this location, as limited as it is.
I will leave now, as you don't want any more of my help. We will see each other after Tchort has been destroyed.
What does the artifact do and why does Tchort want it?
Are there any other people in Deep Caverns? Besides the Tchortists, I mean.
Do you know what this is? ::Show him the shard.::
Let's talk about the shard again.
Do you know what this is? ::Show him the Ethereal Torch.::
Let's talk about the torch again.
I am ready to go.
That is all the questions I've had.
::Wait for him to leave.::
The artifact's purpose is a complex one. It is a powerful item. That should be enough.

We cooperated, and I have visited their home not too far from here. They are not your enemies, unless you've mistreated them in the past - think carefully about your previous actions before engaging them. But whatever your personal disposition towards the Faceless, the artifact must be returned to them.

I was told that a man was spotted relatively near Hollow Earth; multiple times. The Faceless described him as "one with a chaotic mind." He is the only one of your kin that could be found here as far as I know, excluding the Tchortists.

Hollow Earth. Your kin built it in ages which came before, but their own foolishness also razed it. That is what I have been told. It is the home to Tchort's influence and its spawn, creatures that exist for no other purpose than to defend their master. They are legion; attempting to weed them out is futile, for they will come after you again and again.
I have difficulty comprehending Tchort, but I may look at it from a different perspective. Go by what I have told you so far, lest I risk confusing you by relaying unfinished thoughts.

I was only told of it, but it is supposed to act as an entrance to Tchort's... location. The gate is large and sturdy, while this entanglement is made of thick organic matter, most likely produced in the same fashion as the spawn which guard it.
Speak to the Faceless.
I am bound to this place only temporarily by my mission. I do not belong here.
::He peers into it intently and remains silent for a while.::
I am listening.
::He looks at the device intently for a few moments.:: I have seen such instruments. Where have you found this?
I'm listening.
Good. It is time for me to leave too. We will see each other after Tchort has been destroyed.
Very well. I wish you success.
dc_killTchort

But despite that, the creatures are not the greatest threat - Tchort itself is; ending its existence is where your focus should lie. It will be your worst enemy, one you will not likely see until the event in which it is destroyed comes to its resolution, at which point all of his minions should perish as well.
The Faceless might give you a more appropriate answer. Their information too is limited, but their mindset is closer to yours.
I am a creature, like you, but I am not of this world of yours. And while you are submerged completely under it, I stand with one foot in it and with the other outside.
shard

It has a potential to be many things, but I don't know which one it would be for you. There is a darkness around it and I cannot pierce into the events surrounding it. I do, however, know that they are far off from here.
It used to be a shard before it transformed into this.
The artifact's purpose should not be your concern. You only need to make sure it is returned to the Faceless.
It will not. The artifact's purpose should not be your concern. You only need to make sure it is returned to the Faceless.
Do so.
They are more similar to your kin than you might think, and they are even connected to mine. Do not obstruct their workings - their mission is important to us all.

His exact location is unknown to me; it was unimportant. I do recall that he was noticed in Faceless territory, slightly north of their checkpoint at the eastern exit from Hollow Earth. I know nothing more than that.

I do not know. It is unlikely, however, that you will be able to easily remove this entanglement. I made a few observations which might help you: From what I have been told, the spawns rarely venture far from Tchort. I have seen them attack the Faceless checkpoints to the east, outside their domain, but they would not pursue me past the south exit from the area, this tunnel here.

Possibly. That is not what I meant, however. There is a section of abandoned storage buildings in their territory, east of Hollow Earth. A resourceful person such as yourself should be able to find something usable there.
How did you come by this?
Do you want the shard back since it was made by your "kind"?
How do you people activate these things?
What do you think I should do with it?
And how did you come by this shard?
There is more to that than you are admitting, but it matters not to me, you can keep that secret.
Do you want the torch back since it was made by your "kind"?
::Tell him how you destroyed the Shadowlith with the torch.::
::Tell him how you destroyed the totem stone of the savages in the Black Sea.::
::Tell him how you killed the savage king in his void/spirit form.::
::Tell him how you killed a void creature with it.::
Do so.
::He becomes somewhat distant for a moment but soon continues.:: Is there anything else you need to know?
::[Intelligence]:: There is something about this area that scares them, right?
It was chipped off a monolith at the entrance to the Black Sea.
A mariner in the Black Sea used it to kill one of the giant savage natives there by throwing it at him. I retrieved it from the savage's corpse.
I have no purpose for it and I will not draw in the darkness around it to cloud the events at hand. It is better that it remains with you.

That is not important to you as you would not be able to do the same. Instead, you should seek a way that would be available to you. Your main problem is that you do not have the eyes to see it properly and I do not know how you overcome that.
That is the real question. I think this piece has a purpose, but whether it's fulfilled through you or not, and whether it will be a benefit to you or not - that I cannot say.
I am listening.
The... "complex" this came from was made by my people for our own purposes.
Perhaps it would be for the best if you kept it. You might need it.
::He listens patiently as you tell him the story of how you descended into the Abyssal Station and destroyed the black monolith you found there and what you learned about it.::
::He listens patiently as you tell him about the temple of the savages and how you destroyed their totem stone.::
::He listens patiently as you tell him about how you struck the savage king down twice.::
::He listens patiently as you tell him the story of how you descended into the Abyssal Station and fought and killed a void creature.::
Go on.
I believe so.

::He raises his arm just like before, but this time it points west.:: There is a cavern there which contains fungal organisms that are different than others in Deep Caverns. Perhaps that is the reason the spawn were unwilling to follow me.
Unlikely.
Chipped off how?
These "savages"? How are they connected to the shard itself?
There is more to that than you are admitting, but it matters not to me, you can keep that secret.
But there is at least one that may know - Azif.
Hold onto it, but proceed carefully.
The complex is used to store many things and retrieving these things is usually not as straightforward as chipping at it.
The complex is used to store many things, but retrieving them is not easy, even for my kind.
It is good that you destroyed it, even though it seems that came about a bit too late. At least now it will cause no more trouble to your people.

There are forces, both person and impersonal, emanating from the outer reaches that can corrupt or annihilate life of this world. Those "savages", as you call them, came under their yoke and the outer thing projected its likeness onto them. Make no mistake, though, destroying a piece of this corrupt complex does not cut off these forces entirely. There are more subtle ways in which they creep in, and your world is soaked in them.
Whatever it is that you killed the second time, was not the man you killed the first time.
These creatures are without count and striking them down individually is of no use. You should have, instead, focused on removing their source.
If you find no other way to remove the entanglement, go there. Maybe you will find something of use.
A man struck it with a mining pick and got turned to pyrite, but he did manage to chip it off.
A man struck it with a mining pick and got carbonized, but he did manage to chip it off.
I think they fear it. At any rate, they fear to draw near the monolith it came from.
But activating the retrieved item is even harder for someone like you. How did you accomplish that?
But activating the retrieved item is even harder.
I do not know what you can do with this one, as you have neither the eyes to see it properly, nor do you know how to grasp it. And I cannot instruct you on these things, even if I wanted to.
::He remains quiet for a bit.::
And where is this monolith?
Azif, whom you surely already know, has activated it for me.
A knowledgable friend of mine did it.
I drank a special concoction that allowed me to take proper hold of it.
I do not know the exact purpose of this particular instrument, but it does resemble a type of... "torch" we use to remove certain otherworldly residue.
Perhaps you should go back to the place we first met and ask our mutual friend Azif for assistance.
I see.
You come to me for answers, yet you withhold such information from me, as if I inquire for my own profit at your expense. Very well. I will not press you on it.

My kin and I are not of this world of yours and sometimes we have to go beyond its... limitations. This occasionally results in things from outer expanses seeping into places where they should not be. When that happens, we use devices such as this to remove them.
And how do you know it came from it?

You should be wary of this phenomenon when consuming any drugs that allow you to see... or even move beyond the safe limits of this world. That torch alone might not be able to save you in a case of a bigger... anomaly.
